title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Red, purple and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite upper left on mount: bracket and "1/96"; in graphite left side on drawing: "repeat" and bracket;in graphite lower center on mount: "warp" [arrow]; in graphite upper center:"satin" and "rep" with indicators to design; in graphite uppper right corner: 8 

Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 35; in graphite right side: 4 motifs in 1 11/16  8 in  3 3/8
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of rows of diamond or chevron-like shapes executed in short parallel strokes

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Red, purple and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-453.
